nodes.body: Gönpo Lingchen (mgon po gling chen) was granted the title of Pacification Commissioner (anfusi 安抚司) in 1728, and there were 1,096 households under his rule. The grain and other taxes were equivalent to 60 (or 64) taels of silver. Lingtsang Gyelpo (gling tshang rgyal po) did not have to travel to Beijing to have an audience with the emperor.
nodes.title: A Brief Summary of Lingtsang
